alert.note: Alert for Camas Prairie (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 2:24PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Twin Falls, southeastern Elmore, east central Owyhee, northwestern Gooding and southwestern Camas Counties through 315 PM MDT... At 223 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cat Creek Summit to Hot Spring. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Anderson Dam, Cat Creek Summit, Deer Heaven Mountain and Anderson Ranch Reservoir around 230 PM MDT. Hill City and Davis Mountain around 240 PM MDT. Fairfield, Glenns Ferry, Corral and Soldier around 250 PM MDT. King Hill around 300 PM MDT. White Arrow Hot Spring around 310 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Be careful of hydroplaning. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
